Caribbean Crisis

A one-month jornada of independent discussions & workshops in NYC & New Jersey about Puerto Rico and the Caribbean as the region faces odious debt, unnatural disasters, and forced migration.

Home About

Calendar of independent events maintained by Columbia University Libraries working with Prof. Frances Negrón.

Connect, Discuss, Organize

September 29

Puerto Rico Mapathon for Hurricane Relief

Columbia University, Studio@Butler (Butler Library 208B) | 2PM-5PM

Columbia's Group for Experimental Methods in the Humanities and Columbia University Libraries. Organized by Alex Gil, Manan Ahmed, Dennis Tenen, Juan Saldarriaga, Jeremiah Christensen & Moacir de sa Pereira.

October 4

Unnatural: Environmental Disasters and Domination in the Contemporary Caribbean

Columbia University, Heyman Center | 5PM-7PM

Monxo Lopez, Nastasha Lightfoot, Frances Negrón-Muntaner, Michael Ralph, Keisha I. Wiel.

October 5-November 18

Fantasy Island: An Immersive Multimedia Installation

Loisaida Cultural Center | 7PM

Featuring: Shey Rivera, Huascar Robles.

October 12-13

Caribbean Cosmopolis: Timeports of Modernity

Stony Brook University, Humanities Institute

Organizers: Kathleen Wilson, Lena Burgos-Lafuente, Tracey Walters, and Eric Zolov

Featuring: David Scott; Yvonne Fabella, Kristen Block, Anne Eller, Richard Rosa, Esther Whitfield, Kelly Josephs, Agnes Lugo-Ortiz, Elena Schneider, José Quiroga, Trevor Burnard.

October 14

PROMESA: The Fiscal Crisis in Puerto Rico and the Debt of Artists

El Museo del Barrio | 1PM-3PM

Featuring: Yarimar Bonilla, Yasmin Hernández, Celestino Ortiz, and Adrián Viajero Román.

October 17

[TBD]

NYU

Featuring Yarimar Bonilla, Sybille Fisher.

October 20

Bankruptcy and Citizenship: Puerto Rico a 21st Century Colony?

Princeton University

Featuring: Rafael Cox Alomar, Juan Gonzalez, Sergio Marxuach, Efrén Rivera Ramos, Frances Negrón-Muntaner, Charles Venator-Santiago, Esther Vicente.
